00026 #ifndef _JAVASOFT_JAWT_MD_H_
00027 #define _JAVASOFT_JAWT_MD_H_
00028 
00029 #include "jawt.h"
00030 
00031 #ifdef __OBJC__
00032 #import <QuartzCore/CALayer.h>
00033 #endif
00034 
00035 #ifdef __cplusplus
00036 extern "C" {
00037 #endif
00038 
00039 /*
00040  * Mac OS X specific declarations for AWT native interface.
00041  * See notes in jawt.h for an example of use.
00042  */
00043 
00044 /*
00045  * When calling JAWT_GetAWT with a JAWT version less than 1.7, you must pass this
00046  * flag or you will not be able to get a valid drawing surface and JAWT_GetAWT will
00047  * return false. This is to maintain compatibility with applications that used the
00048  * interface with Java 6 which had multiple rendering models. This flag is not necessary
00049  * when JAWT version 1.7 or greater is used as this is the only supported rendering mode.
00050  *
00051  * Example:
00052  *   JAWT awt;
00053  *   awt.version = JAWT_VERSION_1_4 | JAWT_MACOSX_USE_CALAYER;
00054  *   jboolean success = JAWT_GetAWT(env, &awt);
00055  */
00056 #define JAWT_MACOSX_USE_CALAYER 0x80000000
00057 
00058 /*
00059  * When the native Cocoa toolkit is in use, the pointer stored in
00060  * JAWT_DrawingSurfaceInfo->platformInfo points to a NSObject that conforms to the
00061  * JAWT_SurfaceLayers protocol. Setting the layer property of this object will cause the
00062  * specified layer to be overlaid on the Components rectangle. If the window the
00063  * Component belongs to has a CALayer attached to it, this layer will be accessible via
00064  * the windowLayer property.
00065  */
00066 #ifdef __OBJC__
00067 @protocol JAWT_SurfaceLayers
00068 @property (readwrite, retain) CALayer *layer;
00069 @property (readonly) CALayer *windowLayer;
00070 @end
00071 #endif
00072 
00073 #ifdef __cplusplus
00074 }
00075 #endif
00076 
00077 #endif /* !_JAVASOFT_JAWT_MD_H_ */
